TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit JsonSerializer extends System.Object
public ref class JsonSerializer abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides functionality to serialize objects or value types to JSON and to deserialize JSON into objects or value types.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Deserialize (ReadOnlySpan<byte> utf8Json, Type returnType, System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions options = null);

static member Deserialize : ReadOnlySpan<byte> * Type * System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions -> obj

Docs.param: The JSON text to parse.
The type of the object to convert to and return.
Options to control the behavior during parsing.
Docs.summary: Parses the UTF-8 encoded text representing a single JSON value into an instance of a specified type.
Docs.returns: A representation of the JSON value.
Docs.exception: The JSON is invalid, is not compatible with the JSON, or when there is remaining data in the Stream.

Docs.param: The JSON text to parse.
The type of the object to convert to and return.
Options to control the behavior during parsing.
Docs.summary: Parses the text representing a single JSON value into an instance of a specified type.
Docs.returns: A representation of the JSON value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Using a <xref:System.String> is not as efficient as using the UTF-8 methods since the implementation natively uses UTF-8.

Docs.exception: The JSON is invalid, the is not compatible with the JSON, or when there is remaining data in the Stream.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Deserialize (ref System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader reader, Type returnType, System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions options = null);
.method public static hidebysig object Deserialize(valuetype System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader& reader, class System.Type returnType, class System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions options) cil managed
Public Shared Function Deserialize (ByRef reader As Utf8JsonReader, returnType As Type, Optional options As JsonSerializerOptions = null) As Object
static member Deserialize : * Type * System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions -> obj

Docs.param: The reader to read.
The type of the object to convert to and return.
Options to control the serializer behavior during reading.
Docs.summary: Reads one JSON value (including objects or arrays) from the provided reader and converts it into an instance of a specified type.
Docs.returns: A representation of the JSON value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> property of `reader` is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.PropertyName?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.None?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader will be advanced by one call to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Read?displayProperty=nameWithType> to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, `reader` will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.
The <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions> used to create the instance of the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader> take precedence over the <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions> when they conflict. Hence, <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.AllowTrailingCommas?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.MaxDepth?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.CommentHandling?displayProperty=nameWithType> are used while reading.

Docs.exception: The JSON is invalid, is not compatible with the JSON, or a value could not be read from the reader.

is not compatible with the JSON.
-or-

## Remarks
If the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType> property of `reader` is <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.PropertyName?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonTokenType.None?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the reader will be advanced by one call to <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Read?displayProperty=nameWithType> to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, `reader` will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.
The <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions> used to create the instance of the <xref:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader> take precedence over the <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions> when they conflict. Hence, <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.AllowTrailingCommas?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.MaxDepth?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.CommentHandling?displayProperty=nameWithType> are used while reading.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Serialize (object value, Type type, System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions options = null);

Docs.param: The value to convert.
The type of the to convert.
Options to control the conversion behavior.
Docs.summary: Converts the value of a specified type into a .
Docs.returns: The string representation of the value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Using a <xref:System.String> is not as efficient as using UTF-8 encoding since the implementation internally uses UTF-8. See also <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.SerializeToUtf8Bytes(System.Object,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)> and <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.SerializeAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Object,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)>.
